newsitem.title: UK: NWE fuel - HS barges up, cargoes wait for tender.
newsitem.headline: NWE fuel - HS barges up, cargoes wait for tender.

text.p: High sulphur cracked barges bounced higher on Thursday, but cargoes were unmoved.
Barges traded at up to $100 fob ARA and one unrepresentative deal was done at $101. The hike was backed by good bunker demand and brought physical prices in line with forward month paper.

The sharpness of the rise -- barges traded at $95-96 on Wednesday -- was an indication of just how aggressive selling had been in Wednesday's quiet market. Dealers had been keen to shift product before the end of the month.
High sulphur cargoes were steady in a tight market that was awaiting the EdP award on Friday.
Dealers said prices were stuck around $100 fob NWE with two end-users understood to be interested in securing cargoes.
Although the tender should give fundamental support to a reasonably tight market, some dealers thought prices might be pushed lower on a "buy low, price high" basis.

Low sulphur cracked cargoes were also steady, staying close to Sept paper at $105-106 fob NWE. A deal on Thursday into a U.K. end user at $109.25 cif NWE was not seen to reflect the true market level.
